Description: Fragment of a marble statuette of an archaic Greek ?Kore (reading of handwriting in register uncertain). Only the head survives. The hair is in two rows of ringlets and the eyes are large. Dark traces on haoir and eyes may be post depositional or paint. Possibly wearing a necklace. The other features have been eroded
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by The Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Imported marble. Similar limestone pieces from Cyprus (Hermary 1989, 425-7, nos 866, 870, 873) dated from the end of the 6th to the beginning of the 5th century BC. Hermary A. 1989, Musée du Louvre. Catalogue des antiquités de Chypre. Sculpture (Paris: Editions de la Réunion des Musées Nationaux).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CB.03) (Phase 3)
